  3462. I add a few drops to my morning moisturizer and a few more to my night cream and my skin glows.
  3463. Not dry and freezy
  3464. Oh, my cuticles are not dry anymore.
  3465. Works well, a few drops on my wet hair after I shower and my hair looks frizz free and shiny even without blowdrying
  3466. My dry curly hair was soft and silky from one application!
  3467. I have super thick kind of long hair, and this argan oil makes it feel less heavy and softer!
  3468. Great product, but disappointed it made me break out on my face.
  3469. After two applications on wet hair of only a few drops of Argan oil, I noticed a huge difference in my hair.
  3470. Not only was it shipped fast but the company even sent an email with other ways to use Argan Oil which I did not know about.
  3471. I frequently color my hair and it's long, so it's prone to dryness.
  3472. readers are wondering, I am an African american male in early 30's.
  3473. That woman's hair was styled professionally with plenty of product - and that's misleading to those of us with long hair.
  3474. and I need at least one dropper full of oil for each area of my body.
  3475. This oil seems as good as the sample of the very expensive oil I tried.
  3476. Also used just a small amount rubbed into palms and then thru my wet just shampooed color treated hair and got a nice shine with no weigh down.
  3477. While adding the oil to my hair does seem to control the frizzies better than without, I also have to put at least half a dropper full, contrary to the description of 'a few drops goes a long way.'
  3478. My hair is long, half way down my back, but just a few drops is good.
  3479. Warning, only use a little on the ends, or it can be really oily!
  3480. I have been rubbing small amount onto my scalp after my morning shower and a little more than that at night before I go to bed.
  3481. I have problems with dry, itchy scalp, started using this oil and not only does it help with my scalp, it leaves my hair soft and shiny!

  3483. I did notice it has an odd smell I can't really place.

  3488. and it's definitely helping my long curly hair be soft and de frizzed.

  3490. After a few drops in my hands (usually 4, I found 2 drops to require just more use)
  3491. : About a month later, my hair started to get some pretty heavy build-up
  3492. It's a really thick consistency and helps my super thick/course hair a lot.
  3493. I also applied a small amount to my hair & it is very soft with a high shine.
  3494. This has no icky smell like some of the other argan oils I have tried before.
  3495. I have tried many different &#34;100% pure&#34; argan oils for the past a few years.
  3496. I have dry, sensitive, acneic skin the spring and summer, and VERY dry, sensitive, acneic skin in the fall and winter.
  3497. I also bought a second bottle of Argan Oil for my adult son who has dry scalp and freezy curly hair.
  3498. I was having end of winter dry skin especially on hands and it has improved the cracks near nails.
  3499. The bottle came nicely wrapped and boxed but the dropper was broken non the less.
  3500. This product absorbs quickly and keeps my skin supple and balanced all day, no more embarrassing shine!
  3501. I'm currently using a few drops on my hair before bed at night - just massaging it in - and I've already noticed a more silky and less dry improvement in my hair!
  3502. So far I only used 3 drops to the entire hair (I have curly big and long hair
  3503. Plus it cuts down on costs because my hair needs like half a dropper full of the oil when I don't mix it.
  3504. I am about 60 percent gray, by my natural color, and the texture of the gray hair is very dry.
  3505. My skin is very dry and no cream can do what this oil has done so far.
  3506. I now use a LITTLE bit in my hair and really like the results-shiny and not frizzy.
  3507. Don't use too much; even three drops will make my hair a little greasy.

  158. This Argan Oil is indistinguishable from the brand I had been using and the delivery system is much better. It's good to compare and I was pleased with the results. I put a couple of drops on the back of my hand from both kinds. They both smelled the same and spread the same. They were both easy to massage in and both were absorbed into my hand the same leaving it feeling beautifully soft and moisturized. Both are organic, imported from Morocco and bottled in the US. In other words, I could see absolutely no difference in the brands.<br />Argan Oil really does a lovely job on its own for multiple purposes, plus I mix it into my recipe for a moisturizing cream. Paying but a fraction the cost of the expensive brand is obviously a great deal. Given the even match, the thing that made this brand stand out was that the dropper in the bottle is much better. Each time I extracted some oil, I got a full dropper from this brand where the other only filled about a quarter full even if I fully squeezed the top. There is plenty in the bottle so that’s not the problem. The other brand’s dropper just isn’t very effective. Once extracted from the bottle, I could wait for a drop or two to drip from each dropper or squeeze a bit to deliver how much I wanted more quickly, however with this brand that amount could be a lot more. That matters when I am applying it to my head and hair for a deep moisturizing treatment since I can finish the job far more quickly. It also matters when I’m making my cream since I get a consistent amount from the dropper quickly.<br />I recommend this brand. I’ll be rebuying as needed.

  224. I truely love it. This is the first argan oil product I've ever tried. I've been using this for about 3 weeks. On my hair, I'd immediately noticed how soft and silky my it became. It's also less brittle. I have very long, thick, wavy hair so I tend to collect a significant amount of hair after conditioning. Since using this argan oil, I've noticed the amount of hair collected is less (I still need to use conditioner though). I use about 15 drops in my hair every other washing. Using 5 drops at a time after towel drying, I rub it into my palms and tossle it into my hair (first finger combing while my head is back, then 5 more drops while my head is leaned forward, then another 5 drops working it the hair while it's laying on my head like cousin &#34;It&#34;.) By this time, it's been worked into my hands & fingertips, so I haven't had to use my cuticle oil. I've also started using it as a moisterizer. It's been terribly dry this winter and the skin around my face got chaffed after blowing my nose so often. I've used my daily facial moisterizer and it was still flakey. After one use of the argan oil, the roughness around my nose went away. It's got a very slight scent. I've got oily skin so every instinct was telling me not to put more oil on my face, but this is remarkable. The oil absorbs well and no heaviness at all. So ever since, I've been using it as a night moisterizer after I remove my makeup. Haven't seen any significant changes with the issues under my eyes, but have only been using it there for about a week (I have fine lines and somewhat dark circles). I also use a drop daily for my chapped lips. This oil has healed my lips faster than any balms I've used. Even makes my lipstick feel less dry (applied after oil is well absorbed).<br /><br />I'd also purchased a bottle for my husband as beard oil. He uses about 7 drops as he's got a very long goatee and whatever's left on his palms he rubs all over his face. He normally doesn't use facial moisterizer and he's amazed at how &#34;not dry&#34; his face is this winter. He'd also noticed that when he pulls on his goatee, there's also less breakage there. He almost never uses any kind of products whatsoever, but this has converted him.<br /><br />All in all a fantastic product.s amazed at how &#34;not dry&#34; his face is this winter. Pat this all over your face and let dry.<br />Take 2-3 drops of the Argan Oil and rub between your palms. Pat this all over your face also, and let it absorb into your skin. I wiped the excess off and it was fine. Later that night, I noticed the skin of that arm was deliciously soft. Smooth, pettable soft. *Perfect* soft.<br /><br />I've since decided that the oiliness was my fault; I simply used too much. That's great, because this is an expensive luxury oil and if a few drops will cover a large area, that's perfect. My next discovery: after getting out of the shower, while your skin is still slightly damp, apply some argan oil. It will help retain some of that moisture, and the damp will help you spread a small amount of oil more easily. It made my skin feel amazing. Dare I suggest this treatment if you have a romantic evening planned?<br /><br />I received this free or virtually so for product testing and review. Apply the drops onto the palm of your hand and rub both palms together and then comb through with your fingers (do not pat on) and massage into your hair while your hair is still wet.<br /><br />Aria was extremely gracious and generous with her time, feedback, care and concern.   605. This oil is amazing. I have dry, sensitive, acneic skin the spring and summer, and VERY dry, sensitive, acneic skin in the fall and winter. I have had this skin type for 17 years (I'm 30) and tend to get what I deemed to be hormonal acne under my chin. I have tried every product under the sun: cleaners, toners, moisturizers, creams, lotions, salves. I've tried all-natural concoctions and stuff made in labs, and everything has either dried my skin, made me greasy, and/or clogged my pores. I've eliminated dairy, gluten, sugar, and caffeine from my diet to no avail.<br /><br />Apparently the fix for my almost TWENTY YEAR skin nightmare has been to use nothing at all except water and this argan oil. When I wake up I gently blot my face with a cool, wet washcloth. Later on, while in the (not too hot) shower, I use a facecloth to gently wipe my face, transferring any oil from my t-zone to dryer areas. While my face is damp, I apply two drops (will probably use 3 in the winter) of argan oil to me hands and gently massage into my face. Once out of the shower I will apply (with a q-tip) extra argan oil to areas that are looking rough or dry (or to a pimple). If during the day I sweat a bit, I just use a clean cool washcloth to blot and refresh. I rinse my face with lukewarm water before bed.<br /><br />It seems simple but this routine has reduced my breakouts by 95 percent in only 2 weeks. More importantly my skin looks healthier and less rough. This oil heals pimples and I swear is reducing scarring. I will never be without this product!

  935. I have been reading a lot about argan oil and how it is produced in Morrocco. The nuts are shelled by hand and then they are cold pressed, also by hand. This is why so many products that claim they have argan oil in have very small amounts. I've been looking for pure argan oil and decided on this brand because I have a vitamin c serum from them that I love.<br />The uses for this are unlimited really. It can be used as moisturizer, cuticle oil for nail growth, fixing cracked heals, frizz control and split end moisturizer. I have put a few drops into my rose water toner and moisturize that way. When I remove my nail polish I put it on my nails to rejuvenate them after the remover and polish. This is a really good brand, so I feel confident that argan oil is pure. It has worked very well for me and it's one of my favorite products in my beauty regimen. I was lucky enough to purchase this product at discount so that I could provide my honest opinion. I will definitely buy more when I run out.

I came across the Aria Starr product and was intrigued by the affordable price and the promise of it being completely natural product. I have been using it for about 2 weeks and I am very happy with the results so far. I use it at night before bed and I wake up glowing, not greasy. My makeup applies flawlessly and I do not get oily during the day. I also used to be an avid foundation user, but now all I use is a BB primer which I could never use before without feeling like I needed more coverage. I've always had good skin, but I wanted great skin that I could show off in its most natural form, with no makeup at all. Aria Starr has definitely given me those results!   1223. I am in my early forties and I have thick, coarse hair (I'm Caucasian). I've noticed that my hair has not been as soft and manageable as it used to be in my thirties. I do dye my hair about every 4-5 weeks and I dry and style my hair with a blow dryer. My hair has gotten very dry and unmanageable in the last couple of years I have tried pricey shampoos and conditioners from the salon which helped a little but did not give me the soft, shiny, manageable hair I had. I have tried an Aegean oil mixture that I bought from Target but it left my hair oily feeling and looking that I disposed of it after a week. Also, my face broke out in blemishes during that week I tried the product so it may have irritated my skin. I was about to purchase a special hair dryer that had argan oil strips when I came across this oil. I thought I would give it a try. The reviews were great so I was interested to see how it would work for me. I received it right away in a well packaged box. I washed and conditioned my hair like normal and then applied some oil in the palm of my hand and rubbed it in my hair. I used almost two droppers full on my shoulder length hair which was way too much. My hair was very soft but slightly oily. It surprisingly was not greasy or greasy looking but not quite right. The next time I used about 6 drops total throughout my hair and blow dried. My hair is so soft, shiny, and manageable. I kept touching my hair through the day. Welcome back soft, shiny hair! I still need to use the flat iron a little to manage my wavy hair but looks great now. I started using this product on my young sons hair after their bath and before blow drying. It seems to keep their hair soft and easier to comb/straighten in the morning with their &#34;bed head&#34;. I plan to purchase another bottle although this bottle will last awhile since you just need drops for each application.

The Aria Starr argan oil feels very luxurious, and I'd recommend it to anyone who has dry skin or hair!

Additionally, the seller went out its way to follow up with me, educate me with the many uses of the product in a follow up email, the product was delivered very quickly, and packaged well. A+ service, Amazon and AriaStarrBeauty!<br /><br />I am new to Argan oil. I've used it pre-mixed into other commercial products (hair serum, shampoo, body butter) but have never used it as a stand alone serum or treatment. I have very dry, sensitive skin and winter is just around the corner (be aware, though, this product is often marketed to those with oily skin as a balancer so this &#34;dry&#34; oil can benefit people with different needs). I need more moisture generally, and specifically at this time of year, so I was looking at other serums, capsules, and creams. I came across this randomly on Amazon and being on a bit more of a natural beauty kick lately, I decided to buy this and try it out.<br /><br />At the same time, I am trying to transition back into retinol use after a year's hiatus. My skin isn't in its best shape, but this argan oil mixed with my firming serum in the morning helps the serum to glide into the skin during application and makes a smoother base before I apply sunsceen and foundation. I apply the oil lightly to irritated areas throughout the day when I am at home. This has calmed and kept my upper cheeks, forehead, and nose/eye areas moisturized while my skin's working through adapting to the retinol again. The argan oil is great if you are applying a thick handcream and plan to wear gloves for a bit. For people like me with very dry, sensitive skin and increased moisture needs, this works well to help hydrate and lock in the moisture of other products for a longer period of time. My favorite use for this is as a lip treatment -- squeeze a drop from the dropper onto your finger or palm and then gently smooth this over your lips. I use a very emolient gloss at night over the argan oil on my lips and I have noticed a difference (smoother lips in the morning and overall) just with the addition of the argan oil prior to application.<br /><br />I don't think argan oil is the miracle cure or anything, but this is a great staple for nourishing your skin, hair, and nails on a regular basis and it's simple, natural, and highly versatile. The price, quality, and service were great with my order, so if you're thinking of trying an argan oil, I recommend this one. Thanks, Amazon!
